abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Shandong Environment
            Project for China were as follows: the outcome was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was modest, and the Bank
            and borrower performance were both satisfactory. Lessons
            learned from the project: Transfer of Bank procurement
            administration to the Country Office specialists was
            efficient and cost-effective, as it facilitated project
            implementation through prompt reviews, improved
            communication and follow-up. Achievement of project
            objectives was greatly facilitated by the degree of
            ownership demonstrated by the client. Fees charged for
            wastewater services need to be converted to a wastewater
            tariff so that the funds collected become legal revenue of
            the wastewater company. As in other China urban
            infrastructure projects of similar vintage, costs are
            overestimated through mandatory use of government schedules
            of rates (which have proved to be 20 percent to 30 percent
            higher than contract awards). Public-private partnerships in
            the form of management contracts and financial participation
            through sale of stock is becoming increasingly popular in
            the water supply and wastewater sectors. The experience with
            the expansion of the Jinan water distribution network not
            being completed per the dated covenant points to the fact
            that works integral to the project should be included in the
            project, at least as reserve procurement.

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of the Shandong
            Environment Project is to support China's efforts to
            put in place a sustainable environmental framework for the
            long-term economic and social development of the province,
            while supporting a conducive foundation for industrial
            growth. The project, part of a phased development program,
            comprises a blend of policy and investment initiatives,
            which support municipal strategies for environmental
            recovery and sustained use of natural water resources.  The
            five core components are: 1) investments in the Jihan
            Municipality for surface-water storage, pumping,
            transmission, and distribution facilities to improve water
            supply system reliability and protect groundwater; and
            investments in wastewater collection and pumping stations to
            protect Xiaoqing River water quality and fully use existing
            treatment facilities; 2) investments in district heating
            systems in Weihai Municipality, comprising combined heat and
            power generation plant and facilities, distribution systems,
            and support services for improved air quality; 3)
            investments in district heating systems in Yantai
            Municipality, comprising peak boiler and heat exchange plant
            and facilities, distribution systems, and support services
            for improved air quality; 4) environmental pollution and
            control; and 5) investments to support and strengthen
            provincial, municipal, project, and financial management, as
            well as construction of supervision services, training in
            sector and utility operations,  and updating of the Xiaoqing
            River Basin water quality and management database.

TF040147-CHINA: REVIEW OF INDUSTRIAL

repnme.cdata!:
China - Shandong Urban Environmental
            Protection Project : environmental impact statement

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment of the
            Shandong Urban Environmental Protection Project discusses
            environmental impacts during the construction and operation
            phases of four subprojects distributed among three cities in
            Shandong province: (1) the Jinan Yellow River Water Supply
            Pondage Reservoir project (Reservoir Project), which pipes
            water to Jinan's No. 2 Water Purification Plant; (2)
            the Jinan Waste Water Network project involving wastewater
            treatment (Wastewater Project); and (3) the Yantai 500
            Heating Network project (Heating Project), which transports
            heat produced by the Huangbohai CHP Company to Zhifu
            District; and the Weihai No. 3 CHP Plant project. Reservoir
            Project mitigation measures include: (1) preventing seepage
            from salinization by: (a) placing a soil film on the slope
            of the box dam and connecting it with another soil film
            vertically buried under the ground of the dam base; and (b)
            redesigning and re-planning the discharge system for
            adjacent farmland; (2) protecting water quality by: (a)
            burying water delivery pipes underground; and (b) using
            plowing to prevent the sedimentation basins and sand
            stockyards from desertification. Mitigation measures taken
            for the Wastewater Project include using advanced machines,
            rationally arranging construction time, high construction
            efficiency, spraying water and covering the soil to reduce
            the impacts of noise and dust to minimum level. The Heating
            Project will mitigate the environmental impacts during the
            construction phase by: (1) burying the pipeline network
            under land which does not have natural resources; (2)
            strengthening traffic management so that construction does
            not interfere with the main traffic arteries and commercial
            streets; (3) using advanced low-noise machines to reduce
            noise disturbances; and (4) spraying water on the sands and
            soils at the roadsides to reduce raising dust. After
            operation, the Heating Project will use the following
            measures: (1) removing dust by water film, adding limestone
            for desulfurization, and equipping the coalyard with a water
            spraying instrument to reduce air pollution; (2) using low
            noise machines and soundproof facilities; (3) transporting
            ash and cinder to a brick factory; and (4) discharging
            wastewater to a treatment plant. Mitigation during the
            construction and operation phases in the CHP Project
            comprise measures similar to those to be used in the Heating Project.
